title: Volkswagen Group Announces €3 Billion Battery Gigafactory In Spain
notes:
Location:
- The battery gigafactory is located in Sagunt near Valencia, Spain.

Capacity:
- The manufacturing capacity of the gigafactory is planned to be up to 40 GWh/year.

Investment amounts:
- The investment for the gigafactory is €3 billion ($3.2 billion).
- The project is expected to receive funds from the Strategic Project for Economic Recovery and Transformation program (PERTE).

Project progress:
- Construction is set to start in Q1 2023.
- Production is expected to commence in 2026.
- The project is expected to create 3,000 new jobs.

Project type:
- The project is a new build gigafactory.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

title: Envision Group to lead development of battery gigafactory in Extremadura
notes:
Location:
- The Venergy+ project is located in Navalmoral de la Mata, Cáceres, Extremadura, Spain.

Capacity:
- The planned investment for the battery gigafactory is 900 million euros, with a target of creating employment for around 3,000 people from 2025. The solar power plant to be installed by Acciona is planned to reach a capacity of 30 GW by 2030.

Investment amounts:
- The planned investment to launch Venergy+ is one billion euros. The project has applied for funding from the Strategic Projects for Economic Recovery and Transformation for Electric and Connected Vehicles (PERTE VEC).

Project progress:
- The decision to construct the battery gigafactory in Navalmoral de la Mata was made after negotiations with the Spanish Government and with the support of the Regional Government of Extremadura, which has provided 200 hectares of land for development. The project is in the phase of establishing a consortium of twelve companies, with plans to create thousands of high-value green jobs for the future.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new battery gigafactory.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cell fabrication, module assembly, and will be powered by an on-site solar power plant to supply clean energy.

R&D collaboration:
- The project encourages collaborative R&D across the entire battery life cycle, from storage to reuse, with smart charging and closed-loop recycling.

title: Envision-led consortium plans to build EV battery plant in Spain
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in the town of Navalmoral de la Mata in Extremadura, Spain.

Capacity:
- The factory is planned to have a capacity of 10GWh during the first phase, with a subsequent increase to 30GWh by 2030.

Investment amounts:
- The project is a $1 billion initiative, with funding sought from the Spanish government’s funding unit, PERTE VEC.
- Spanish renewables company Acciona Energia will supply electricity to the facility through an on-site solar farm.

Project progress:
- The EV battery plant is expected to become operational in 2025.
- The Envision-led consortium has formed a partnership with 11 entities for the development of the project, with the aim of creating around 3,000 new jobs.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, featuring a factory and a supporting ecosystem.

Value chain stages:
- The plant will manufacture battery cells of high performance, modules, and packs with high density and extended range.

title: Spain to invest €4.3bn in EV and battery manufacturing
notes:
Location:
- Spain

Capacity:
- N/A

Investment amounts:
- The public plan includes grants for building Spain's first battery plant and boosting EV manufacturing. The private sector is estimated to contribute a further €19.7bn to the initiative between 2021 and 2023. Spain will receive around €70bn in grants until 2026 to help revive its economy.

Project progress:
- The government aims for the number of new EVs registered in the country to reach 250,000 in 2023, a significant increase from the 18,000 registered in 2020. There are plans to encourage the purchase of greener cars and expand charging infrastructure to promote electric vehicles.

Project type:
- The project involves building the country's first battery plant and boosting manufacturing of EVs. It also includes a wider project covering all aspects of EV production, from mining to battery production and the manufacturing of a finished vehicle at SEAT's assembly plant near Barcelona.

Value chain stages:
- The project aims to cover the entire production chain, including battery production, and the manufacturing of a finished vehicle at SEAT's assembly plant near Barcelona.

title: Spain to Invest $5,1 Bln in Battery Electric Vehicle Production
notes:
Location:
- Spain

Capacity:
- N/A

Investment amounts:
- Spain plans to invest 4.3 billion euros ($5.1 billion) in kick-starting the production of electric vehicles and batteries. The private sector is expected to contribute an additional 19.7 billion euros to the initiative from 2021 to 2023.

Project progress:
- The government-run plan aims to include the entire production chain, providing grants to companies with the goal of building the country’s first battery plant and boosting electric vehicle manufacturing. The program is part of a 13-billion euro package earmarked for sustainable mobility, with the expectation of creating up to 140,000 new jobs and boosting the national economy by 1%-1.7%. The plan also aims to increase the number of new electric vehicles registered to 250,000 in 2023, supported by government-sponsored initiatives to purchase cleaner cars and expand charging stations.

title: EU approves Spanish subsidy programme for EV batteries
notes:
Location:
- Spain

Capacity:
- N/A

Investment amounts:
- The EU Commission has approved an €837 million Spanish government programme to support the production of batteries for electric vehicles. The support will be provided in the form of direct grants and loans. The maximum amount of aid per beneficiary is €300 million for investments in the production of batteries, €100 million for essential battery components, or €25 million for investments in the extraction of raw materials.

Project progress:
- The approval paves the way for the second call of the so-called PERTE VEC – a funding programme for electric and connected vehicles projects considered strategic for economic recovery and transformation. Spain’s government intends to launch two new tenders for the production of electric vehicles and batteries in July 2023.
